properties.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 3 at 2:38AM MST until March 4 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland KS
properties.description:
...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED FOR PORTIONS OF THE
TRI STATE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...

.A developing surface trough along the Front Range late Wednesday
morning into the afternoon hours will be the focus for a strong
southerly gradient out over western and northwestern portions of
the area. These winds will aid in creating above normal temperatures
and dry conditions, allowing for fire weather concerns to ensue.

The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire
Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in
effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon.

* Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma...
Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254
Cheyenne. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne...Fire
Weather Zone 002 Rawlins and Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman. In
Nebraska...Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy and Fire Weather Zone
080 Hitchcock.

* Winds...South 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph.

* Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent.

* Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior
and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
properties.instruction:
A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions
are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible
red flag warnings.

NWSheadline: FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001...002...013...079...080...252...253 AND 254
